description.narrative: CIP has come to monitor reduced tax issues for non-general extractive sector projects and gas sector in particular. The results of the study including all the relevant documents are simplified and shared with the communities in Cabo Delgado province and other places to ensure that people have the information to demand accountability. CIP is working with the provincial government and provincial assembly bringing good results in terms of good debate and management improvement. For the purpose of this project, CIP will lead activities geared towards mobilizing local actors in timely reporting of incidents, capacity building, mediation and influencing. The action operates in selected extractive and conflict affected communities, districts and provinces. These areas incorporate the synergy between conflict and extraction that the call is aiming to mediate. The main target groups are the existing organized groups of civil society, government and private sector stakeholders mentioned as subjects to the activities and listed here: civil society organizations, community based organizations and local structures, including community resettlement committees, councils of traditional authorities etc.; government stakeholders, which include the provincial governments of Sofala, Cabe Delgado and Inhambane and district governments of Palma, Montepuez and Inhassaoro; Extractive Industry companies. CIP has their feet on the ground in the proposed implementing areas.

participating-org.narrative: CENTRO DE INTEGRIDADE PÚBLICA CENTER FOR PUBLIC INTEGRITY

CIP was founded in 2005 as a NGO working on Good Governance, Transparency and Integrity and has since developed research, campaigning and lobbying on the themes of Decentralization and Local Governance, Elections and Political Funding, Fiscal Transparency, Procurement, Social Control, Oversight and Anti-Corruption, Foreign Aid and Dependence, Monitoring Anti-Poverty Programming, Extractive Industries and Forestry. The organization is funded through a common fund, with participation of sixpartners (Switzerland, Denmark, Norway, Oxfam Novib, IBIS and DFID).
CIP is a recognized actor in civil society at national and international level. He is a member of the G20 and Forum de Monitoria de Orcamento. CIP participates in movements and is affiliated with Transparency International. CIP is also working with IBP, IIED, CSA, Publish What You Pay Platform and Global Integrity. CIP participated as a partner in the needs assessment with the Centre for Economic Governance and AIDS in Africa (CEGAA) for preparation of the project "Participatory Budget Monitoring and Tracking Resource for Health and HIV / AIDS", a project implemented in Mozambique, Zambia, Zimbabwe <(>&<)> Malawi.
CIP is actually leading the National Platform of Natural Resources and Extractive Industryand is one of the CSO members of the EITI MSG from Mozambique, playing a very important role in the extractive sector in Mozambique.
